thread.title: Japan, Korean Stocks Hit by Earnings News

author: Lucy Craymer
title: Japan, Korean Stocks Hit by Earnings News
text:
U.S. shows pickup in hiring Deutsche Bank shares drop after results Global bond yields climb The Dow Jones Industrial Average was on track for its worst week in more than two years, as a selloff in government bonds and disappointing earnings reports sent stocks lower Friday.
In the past week, the blue-chip index has fallen about 2.8%, including Fridayâ€™s losses, on pace for its worst weekly decline since January 2016, when steep falls in Chinese equities spilled over to global markets.
